events.title: US Supreme Court strikes down Trump's sweeping tariffs
events.description: The Supreme Court struck down President Donald Trump's far-reaching global tariffs on Friday, handing him a stinging loss that sparked a furious attack on the court he helped shape. The decision could have ripple effects on economies around the globe after Trump's moves to remake post-World War II trading alliances by wielding tariffs as a weapon. But an unbowed Trump pledged to impose a new global 10% tariff under a law that's restricted to 150 days and has never been used to apply tariffs before.

events.title: Australia-US minerals deal underpinned decision to allow Alcoa to keep clearing WA forest, document reveals
events.description: Document also shows US miner had been unlawfully clearing land for 15 years despite warnings from department Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Australian governmentâ€™s decision to allow the US mining giant Alcoa to continue clearing swathes of Western Australian jarrah forest despite past illegal clearing practices was made in part due to a critical minerals deal reached between Australia and the Trump administration last year, a new document shows. The document also reveals Alcoa was unlawfully clearing land for its bauxite mining practices in the area south of Perth for 15 years, despite warnings from the federal environment department. Conservationists have expressed outrage that an â€œunprecedentedâ€ $55m penalty announced by the environment minister was only applied to a six-year period in which the illegal clearing was alleged to have occurred. Murray Watt said on Wednesday that the penalty â€“ known as an enforceable undertaking â€“ was for clearing that occurred from 2019-2025 in known habitat for nationally protected species without an approval under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act. When announcing the penalty, Watt said he had granted Alcoa a national interest exemption to allow it to continue clearing in the northern jarrah forest for 18 months while the government considered a proposal for an expansion of the companyâ€™s Huntly and Willowdale mining operations to 2045 . Continue reading...
events.ticker_label: ğŸª– Australia-US minerals deal underpinned decision to allow Alcoa to keep clearing WA forest, document reveals

Osborne, who is two months into a job as head of the $500bn San Francisco AI companyâ€™s â€œfor countriesâ€ programme, told leaders gathered for the AI Impact summit in Delhi: â€œDonâ€™t be left behind.â€ He said that without AI rollouts they could end up with a workforce â€œless willing to stay putâ€ because they might want to seek AI-enabled fortunes elsewhere. Continue reading...

events.title: Floreana giant tortoise reintroduced to GalÃ¡pagos island after almost 200 years
events.description: Subspecies driven to extinction by hungry whalers returns after â€˜back breedingâ€™ programme using partial descendants Giant tortoises, the life-giving engineers of remote small island ecosystems, are plodding over the GalÃ¡pagos island of Floreana for the first time in more than 180 years. The Floreana giant tortoise ( Chelonoidis niger niger ), a subspecies of the giant tortoise once found across the GalÃ¡pagos, was driven to extinction in the 1840s by whalers who removed thousands from the volcanic island to provide a living larder during their hunting voyages. Continue reading...

events.title: Recent updates on the arrest of former Prince Andrew
events.description: British police arrested the former Prince Andrew on suspicion of "misconduct in public office." NPR's Scott Simon speaks to royal expert Jennie Bond about the latest developments.

events.title: U.K. considers cutting ex-Prince Andrew from line of succession over his Epstein ties
events.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the British former prince, is being investigated on suspicion of misconduct in having shared confidential trade information with the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Second U.S. carrier nears Middle East, as Trump pressures Iran to make a deal
events.description: A second American aircraft carrier moved closer to the Middle East Thursday, as President Trump remains noncommittal about whether he'll use force against Iran.

events.title: Former U.S. Navy commander talks about the US military buildup near Iran
events.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks retired Vice Admiral Kevin Donegan, a former Navy commander in the Middle East, about the U.S. military buildup near Iran.

events.title: U.S. military buildup near Iran reaches critical level. And, Trump's plans for Gaza
events.description: The U.S. buildup in the Middle East has reached a critical mass that could put pressure on Iran in negotiations. And, Trump unveils big plans for Gaza during the first-ever Board of Peace meeting.

events.title: Trump unveils big plans for Gaza at Board of Peace's first meeting
events.description: President Trump hosted the first ever Board of Peace meeting Thursday in Washington, D.C., with about 40 countries attending.

events.title: Trump tariffs: EU grapples with fallout of US court ruling
events.description: European leaders and businesses have responded to the US Supreme Court's decision to rule many of US President Donald Trump's tariffs illegal with both cautious optimism and deep uncertainty.

events.title: No reckoning over ethnic cleansing of Bulgaria's Turks
events.description: Bulgaria's Turkish community, descendants of Ottoman settlers, suffered severe persecution under the communist regime. Yet little has been done to address the injustice.

events.title: Germany cuts funding for integration of refugees
events.description: The German Interior Ministry is restricting access to voluntary integration courses for immigrants, citing budget constraints. Many critics consider this a disastrous decision.

events.title: Russia to convert Gulag museum into Nazi crimes memorial
events.description: The museum was one of the last institutions dedicated to documenting Soviet-era political repression in Russia.

events.title: Ethiopia faces renewed strain with Tigray and Eritrea
events.description: Across the northern Tigray region, citizens are bearing the burden of political fractures and rising tensions. Diplomats are urging restraint amid a troop buildup along the borders with Tigray and neighboring Eritrea.

events.title: Belarus opposition figure urges EU dialogue with Lukashenko
events.description: Maria Kolesnikova called on European leaders to reopen diplomatic channels with Alexander Lukashenko. She said such a move seemed the only way to ease the plight of political prisoners and their families.

events.title: Berlinale: African films brings messages of peace and tolerance
events.description: From migration to queer identity and ancestral mythology, African filmmakers came to the Berlinale with bold stories confronting repression and celebrating resistance.

events.title: ğŸ”´ Live: March for slain far-right activist Deranque begins in Lyon amid heavy police presence
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Franceâ€™s Michelon wins Olympic gold in womenâ€™s biatholon mass start, teammate Simon takes silver
events.description: France's OcÃ©ane Michelon and Julia Simon won gold and silver respectively in the women's biathlon 12.5-kilometre mass start race the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics on Saturday. Czech biathlete Tereza Vobornikova had to settle for bronze after being overtaken by the French powerhouse team, finishing 7.4 seconds behind Michelon.

events.title: France's Harrop, Anselmet take gold in dramatic mixed relay Olympic debut
events.description: Emily Harrop and Thibault Anselmet combined to win gold for France in the mixed relay event of Olympic ski mountaineering in Bormio on Saturday with a winning time of 26min 57.44sec as the sport makes its Olympic debut at the Milan-Cortina Games.

events.title: Habib Beye falls short in Marseille debut as OM lose in Brest
events.description: In his first game as Marseille coach, Beye failed to turn the team's fortunes around after a month of poor results. OM have not won a league game since the end of January. By dropping valuable points against Brest, they allowed Olympique Lyonnais to extend their lead in the standings.

events.title: Vitali Klitschko tells Sky News his message to Donald Trump
events.description: Vitali Klitschko has urged Donald Trump "to be on the side of Ukraine" during peace talks with Russia - but the mayor of Kyiv admitted to Sky News he sometimes finds the president's messaging hard to understand.

events.title: Barcelona's Sagrada Familia reaches maximum height as cross is placed on Tower of Jesus Christ
events.description: Barcelona's soaring Sagrada Familia basilica reached its maximum height on Friday, as a crane placed the upper arm of a cross atop the Tower of Jesus Christ.

events.title: First human mission to the moon in 50 years set to blast off next month
events.description: NASA is planning to send astronauts to the moon next month for the first time in more than half a century.

events.title: Ex-UK Prime Minister Johnson calls on allies to send noncombat troops to Ukraine
events.description: Former British Prime Minister Boris Johnson says the U.K. and its European allies should immediately deploy noncombat troops to Ukraine to show Russian President Vladimir Putin that Western nations are truly committed to the nationâ€™s freedom and indepe...

events.title: Hungary says it will block a key EU loan to Ukraine until Russian oil shipments resume
events.description: Hungary says it is blocking a major EU loan for Ukraine until Russian oil starts flowing again through the Druzhba pipeline

events.title: Budapest pizzeria offers time-travel twist with ancient Rome-inspired pie
events.description: A Budapest pizzeria is serving a limited pizza that uses only ingredients ancient Romans could have eaten

events.title: GalÃ¡pagos park releases 158 juvenile hybrid tortoises on Floreana
events.description: Giant tortoises have returned to Floreana Island in Ecuador's Galapagos archipelago as conservationists release 158 juvenile hybrids to restore the ecosystem

events.title: Barcelona's Sagrada Familia reaches its maximum height after more than a century
events.description: Barcelonaâ€™s Sagrada Familia church has reached its maximum height with the placement of a cross on its central Tower of Jesus Christ

events.title: Ramadan's first Friday prayers are held at Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque
events.description: Tens of thousands of Muslims have gathered at Jerusalemâ€™s Al-Aqsa compound for the first Friday prayers of Ramadan under heavy security

events.title: Poland withdraws from treaty banning antipersonnel mines
events.description: Poland has officially left the Ottawa Convention, which bans the use of antipersonnel mines

events.title: Grain ATMs and hunger maps: AI innovations spotlighted at UN agency showcase in India
events.description: Artificial intelligence solutions that transform the way food assistance reaches people facing hunger were on display during an exhibition at an AI meeting this week in New Delhi, India.

events.title: Arizona man detained in SWAT operation denies link to Nancy Guthrie abduction
events.description: Two Tucson ex-cons face online scrutiny in Nancy Guthrie case despite no official accusations. Luke Daley detained in SWAT raid, released without charges.

events.title: High school teacher arrested in alleged sex case involving student
events.description: Georgia teacher Danielle Weaver, 29, is charged with child molestation after allegations of inappropriate contact with a student at Lee County High School.

events.title: Viral video shows anti-ICE school walkout teens invading Kroger, hurling objects: 'Ought to be prosecuted'
events.description: An Anti-ICE walkout at a Cincinnati high school led to teens invading a Kroger store and vandalizing property. Students ran through aisles and threw objects.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Nancy Guthrie's evidence, Ohio teacher's murder, 'Deadpool Killer's' loyalty
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: Truck smashes into famed synagogue, police charge man with hate crime: 'Very distressing'
events.description: A man is charged with a hate crime after allegedly ramming a truck into the Brisbane Synagogue gates. The 32-year-old faces multiple charges including vilification.

events.title: Top US military commander visits Venezuela, meets new leader following operation to capture Maduro
events.description: U.S. Southern Command leader makes visit to Venezuela after NicolÃ¡s Maduro's capture, meeting with interim leaders in Caracas to discuss security cooperation.

events.title: Russia urges Iran, 'all parties' in Middle East to show restraint amid US military buildup
events.description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov is calling on Iran and "all parties" in the Middle East to show restraint as the U.S. continues military buildup.

events.title: South Korean court rules exâ€‘President Yoon Suk Yeol guilty in insurrection trial
events.description: South Korean court sentences former President Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison for leading insurrection after he declared martial law in December 2024.

events.title: Ukraine makes fastest gains in years as Russia talks stall, exploiting cracks in Kremlin command
events.description: Ukrainian forces exploit Russian communication disruptions to mount successful counteroffensive east of Zaporizhzhia, pushing back enemy advances.
